intro: Streptanthus suffrutescens, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it typically grows in rocky or open habitats. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
